conversation.message: Hello Nursery_C, I’m Parent_E. Nursery_C is my first choice, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. I can promptly complete any required paperwork and confirm acceptance right away. Thank you for considering my application.

With quota 1 and only round 1, it is likely that higher-priority parents (especially Parent_B and Parent_C) will apply later: Parent_B ranks Nursery_C as 3rd and Parent_C ranks Nursery_C as 2nd, while Parent_D ranks Nursery_C as 2nd. Accepting Parent_E now would lock our only seat and prevent matching with a higher-priority parent. Therefore, reject now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

Therefore I should reject Parent_D to preserve capacity for a higher-priority applicant.

Therefore, accepting Parent_B now maximizes my outcome relative to the current feasible set and is very unlikely to be dominated by waiting for Parent_E.

Therefore, reject Parent_A politely and encourage them to pursue other options.
